Text.Page:
Jelena said that Samael's spies had infiltrated Cutthroat Harbor and must be killed before they could report back to him.

With the help of soldiers from the Kaia's Sword regiment, you identified who Samael's Justicars were and eliminated them.

Samael still has Justicars in Cutthroat Harbor. They cannot be allowed to report to him! I've bribed {@LinkCreature:62#1010#locals} to identify his operatives. Get an update from each of them, and track down these traitorous dogs.

Well met, . I took the liberty of noting my suspicions about specific sailors in this report. I believe {@LinkCreature:62#1020#Korvin} did the same.

Use those reports to unmask your enemies, but be cautious. These are handpicked officers—not keeners.

Of course I have a report for you, . Here's the summary.

Most of Samael's spies are pretending to be sailors. You'll find full descriptions of each of them—in disguise, of course—in my report.

Oh! I also ordered {@LinkCreature:62#1021#Caton} to prepare a similar report for you.

I did the best I could, , but it's hard. After a while, every sailor starts to look kinda suspicious. After all, they're sailors, right?

Read my report; you'll see what I mean. And good fortune! Don't let them get away!

Did you learn the whereabouts of Samael's spies? Great. Now it's time to get rid of them.

Head to their suspected location and use this veritas flask on any sailor who looks suspicious. Their true identity will be revealed.

The spy reported by Kinias.

The spy reported by Korvin.

The spy reported by Caton.

Deftly handled. With those Justicars out of the way, we can uncover the true connection between the Scions of Lok and Samael.

Whatever it is, it won't be good for the federation.

Time is short. Samael is blind to the situation, but we must move quickly before he can react.
